item.description:
We'll take a 2-hour hike or snowshoe through Maudslay State Park before driving to Jewell Towne Vineyard for a cellar tour and wine tasting.

Maudslay State Park: The former Moseley family estate on the Merrimack River, this park features 19th century gardens and plantings, rolling meadows, towering pines, and one of the largest naturally occurring stands of mountain laurel in Massachusetts. Most breathtaking are the ornamental trees and masses of azaleas and rhododendrons that bloom in May and June. It's a great place for walking, biking, and in winter a portion of the park is off limits due to roosting bald eagles, but the remainder provides excellent cross country skiing and winter walks.

Jewell Towne Vineyard is conducting wine cellar tours today with tastings of their new wines. They also have a beautiful, rustic-looking tasting room featuring a warm stove and the works of local artists on the walls.

No Pets.

Carpool: 10:45 AM - Portsmouth Park & Ride Lot

185 Grafton Ave. Meet at the back of the commuter lot.

Arrive Maudslay @ 11:30am. Arrive Jewell Towne ~2pm.

Directions to Maudslay State Park: I-95 exit 57 to Rt. 113 West/Storey Ave. Follow 113 west for half a mile then turn right on Hoyts Lane. Go .5 miles to end. At stop sign turn right onto Curzon Mill Rd. then turn right into parking lot.

Directions to Jewell Towne: Jewell Towne straddles the border between South Hampton, NH and Amesbury, MA. Set your GPS to: 183 Whitehall Road, Amesbury, MA.

Directions are on their website here.

Call the winery if you get lost: 603-394-0600

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.


Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Winter Snowshoe/Walk and Wine Tasting
